questions.questionText: 1. When a manager appreciates strong communication skills of a team member and then begins to view the employee as being highly competent in all areas, even if there is no evidence to support the belief.  This is an example of:
questions.explanation: TS uses a colon (:) to separate the property name from the property type

questions.questionText: 2.The percentage of information processed unconsciously by the human brain through experienced-based rules is:
questions.explanation: enum is not used as a type in TypeScript

questions.questionText: 3.Not offering a client facing role to a new father because these would demand late evening conversations with the client, without checking interest of the individual concerned. This is an example of:
questions.explanation: interfaces are typically used to list the properties and methods for an object

questions.questionText: 4.The tendency to rely heavily on the first piece of information encountered when making subsequent judgments or estimates
questions.explanation: number[] is another way of writing Array<number> in TypeScript

questions.questionText: 5.Subjecting certain individuals to heightened scrutiny or questioning their qualifications or abilities more rigorously compared to others.
questions.explanation: a constructor is used by a class to take in parameters

questions.questionText: 6. person telling their colleague that they don't even “look” gay. This is an example of:
questions.explanation: async is not used as an access modifier type in TypeScript
the export keyword allows for the information to be transmitted between files

questions.questionText: 8.What is the purpose of Unconscious Bias Training
questions.explanation: filter is a method used to conditionally create a new array

questions.questionText: 9._________________ occurs when individuals with disabilities are used as symbols of diversity or inclusion without genuine opportunities for meaningful participation or representation.
questions.explanation: this.propertyName is the way to access a specific property within a class

questions.questionText: 10.Unconscious biases are always negative or harmful
questions.explanation: async is not used as an access modifier type in TypeScript
